radiographic_examinations.findings: Partially thrombosed and calcified infrarenal abdominal aortic aneurysm, measuring 5.0 cm by 5.0 cm by 6.3 cm, extending into both common iliac arteries, without extension of thrombus into the common iliac arteries.
Nonspecific, periventricular white-matter hypodensities consistent with microangiopathic disease, and a tiny chronic cerebellar infarct on the right side.
Dilated left ventricle with severe systolic dysfunction, mild-to-moderate mitral regurgitation, and an ejection fraction of approximately 20%.
